column4: does the front video work for any of you? The site is http://www.vasilisagames.com
Ah thats true
open source 4ever
Okay now, let me ask this. Where can i get something to transcode files without having to use the commmand line?
See? thats all commandline. there's no possible way to gui this?
er yeah
command lines are frightening
:< well i suppose il just bookmark this page then....
Maybe someday ill make my own gui for it :D~
Mine will rule them all.
I just signed in. What do you want to do?
just figuring out what kind of file to embed as a video to open my site, so that the average computer can use it
I do flash streaming video for my websites. I use ffmpeg to do it. i have instructions on the web if you want. Can your web pages support PHP?
then flash will work. i highly recommend. Works with more platforms than anything else. Also mencoder didn't work for me as well as ffmpeg.
I put directions on the web: http://cratel.wichita.edu/cratel/cratel_streaming_video
actually I think it will do it but the metadata info isn't so good....
then why is it giving me "flv not recognized" :( sudo mencoder Office.avi -of flv
dunno, but I'll bet something is wrong in your command. My mencoder cheat sheet is: http://www.mplayerhq.hu/DOCS/HTML/en/menc-feat-selecting-codec.html
does mplayer play your video OK?
so if you type "mplayer <filename.extension>" what error do you get?
install mplayer and see if it likes you file: "sudo apt-get install mplayer"
let it do what it wants. Linux is chatty, but it shouldn't scare you. OS X and WinXP do stuff like that all the time but they shut up about it....
does it play OK and w/ audio and video?
